properties.Name: SettlementAgreement
properties.Description: A Settlement Agreement is made between two parties when they agree to settle or resolve their differences by written agreement.

Columns.Name: ContractId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Contract.

Columns.Name: Date
Columns.Description: The date that the agreement becomes legally effective.

Columns.Name: TitleOfDisputedContract
Columns.Description: The title of the contract in dispute.

Columns.Name: DateOfDisputedContract
Columns.Description: The date of the disputed contract.

Columns.Name: SettlementAgreementSection
Columns.Description: The full and complete text of the Settlement Agreement section.

Columns.Name: ReleaseSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes that by entering into the Settlement Agreement each party agrees never to sue the other party for any reason connected with the disputed agreement.

Columns.Name: PaymentSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes that one party may pay the other party some amount of money as part of the settlement.

Columns.Name: TerminationSection
Columns.Description: This section states the date upon which all obligations in the original disputed contract are to be completely and fully terminated.

Columns.Name: AccordAndSatisfactionSection
Columns.Description: This sections establishes that there has been an accord and satisfaction regarding the original contractual obligations and establishes any payment made by parties is not an admission of liability but simply for the purpose of ending all disputes.

Columns.Name: NonDisclosureSection
Columns.Description: This section provides that neither party will disclose terms of the Settlement Agreement nor will disclose the terms set forth in the Agreement.

Columns.Name: AttorneysFeesAndCostsSection
Columns.Description: This section provides for who will pay for attorney costs and fees associated with the Settlement Agreement.

Columns.Name: SuccessorsAndAssignsSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes that the releases given by each party are effective for anyone that may also be entitles to assert that same party's claim.  It does prevent anyone with a separate right to assert a claim.

Columns.Name: EntireAgreementSection
Columns.Description:
This section makes it clear that this is the final agreement between parties and replaces or supersedes any prior discussions or agreements. 

Any amendments to this Agreement must be made in writing.

Columns.Name: SeverabilitySection
Columns.Description: This section attempts to keep the agreement in effect even if a court rules that a portion is invalid.

Properties.Description: A Settlement Agreement is made between two parties when they agree to settle or resolve their differences by written agreement.
